result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin E Sierra-Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse programs.
Consecutive to: any sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes:
COMPAS Evaluation and follow through
Maintain/obtain full-time employment/school/combination
No contact with victims in PSI
No contact with anyone who uses, sells or possesses illegal drugs or gang members
Anger & psychological evaluation
  -Not enter or be in the United States without proper documentation of lawful presence.
-Report to probation/parole agent within 72 hours of entry, legal or illegal, into the United States.
-Report any changes in immigration status to probation/parole agent within 72 hours.
-Contact probation/parole agent within 24 hours of release from Immigration and Customs Enforcement custody within the United States.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence now serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
